com.exacttarget.etpushsdk

Class ETPush

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.exacttarget.etpushsdk.ETPush

  • public class ETPush
extends Object
    JB4A SDK main class for MobilePush actions. Use readyAimFire(ETPushConfig) to bootstrap your app with the SDK.

    • Method Detail

      • readyAimFire

        public static void readyAimFire(ETPushConfig pushConfig)
                         throws ETException
        Call this from your Application's Application.onCreate() method. This method initializes ETPush and bootstraps it to your app.

        Use ETPushConfig.Builder to provide details of the SFMC MobilePush app you want to connect with as well as which features to enable within the SDK.

        This method will perform all activities on a background thread and will return immediately. We recommend that you use the ReadyAimFireInitCompletedEvent to listen for when this call has completed rather than performing any work immediately after this call or in your Launcher activity to prevent your app from Application Not Responding (ANR) issues.

        readyAimFire() must be the first call before calling any other SDK methods or using any other classes.

        The reason we ask that you call this within your Application class is to ensure that background activities performed to display messages will be able to bootstrap to your app.
        Parameters:
        pushConfig - ETPushConfig
        Throws:
        ETException

      • readyAimFire

        public static void readyAimFire(android.app.Application applicationContext,
                String etAppId,
                String accessToken,
                String gcmSenderId,
                boolean enableEtAnalytics,
                boolean enableWamaAnalytics,
                boolean enableGeolocation,
                boolean enableCloudPages)
                         throws ETException
        We recommend that you use the readyAimFire(ETPushConfig) instead of calling this method directly.

        For more information about the parameters used in this call, please see ETPushConfig.Builder

        For more information about how to use this method, please see readyAimFire(ETPushConfig).
        Throws:
        ETException

      • readyAimFire

        @Deprecated
public static void readyAimFire(android.app.Application applicationContext,
                           String etAppId,
                           String accessToken,
                           String gcmSenderId,
                           boolean enableEtAnalytics,
                           boolean enableGeolocation,
                           boolean enableCloudPages)
                         throws ETException
        Deprecated. use readyAimFire(ETPushConfig) instead.
        Please use readyAimFire(ETPushConfig).
        Throws:
        ETException

      • getInstance

        public static ETPush getInstance()
                          throws ETException
        Provides an instance of the ETPush class that is prepared for you in readyAimFire().

        Before using this method, you must first call readyAimFire(ETPushConfig) from your Application's Application.onCreate() method.

        Remember that readyAimFire() will process all work on a thread. So when you request an instance of ETPush, it must wait for readyAimFire() to be completed. Therefore, rather than calling getInstance() immediately after readyAimFire() or even in your Launcher Activity, we recommend that you listen for the Event ReadyAimFireInitCompletedEvent. Using this Event will prevent Application Not Responding (ANR) messages in your app.
        Returns:
        ETPush singleton getInstance
        Throws:
        ETException

      • pushManager

        @Deprecated
public static ETPush pushManager()
                          throws ETException
        Deprecated. use getInstance() instead.
        Please update to use getInstance()
        Throws:
        ETException

      • setLogLevel

        public static void setLogLevel(int logLevel)
        Set the default level of logging in the SDK. By default will be set to android.util.Log.WARN
        Parameters:
        logLevel - set from Log

      • activityPaused

        public static void activityPaused(android.app.Activity activity)
        Call this method from your Activity's onPause() method for Android versions < 14. Beginning with Android Ice Cream Sandwich (API 14) these callbacks are handled internally.

        The SDK uses these calls to keep track of the open Activities to determine when your app comes into the foreground or is put into the background.

        Several functions within the SDK (such as Analytics, CloudPages, Location) perform actions either when the app comes into the foreground, or when the app is put into the background.

        Failure to call these methods within your Activities will disable functionality you might have been expecting when you bootstrapped your app using readyAimFire(ETPushConfig).
        Parameters:
        activity - The paused Activity.

      • activityResumed

        public static void activityResumed(android.app.Activity activity)
        Call this method from your Activity's onResume() method for Android versions < 14. Beginning with Android Ice Cream Sandwich (API 14) these callbacks are handled internally.

        The SDK uses these calls to keep track of the open Activities to determine when your app comes into the foreground or is put into the background.

        Several functions within the SDK (such as Analytics, CloudPages, Location) perform actions either when the app comes into the foreground, or when the app is put into the background.

        Failure to call these methods within your Activities will disable functionality you might have been expecting when you bootstrapped your app using readyAimFire(ETPushConfig).
        Parameters:
        activity - The paused Activity.

      • getNotificationRecipientClass

        public static Class<?> getNotificationRecipientClass()
        Getter for the Activity that will launch when a notification without a CloudPage or OpenDirect url is tapped that you have set in setNotificationRecipientClass(Class).

        If you did not set this class in setNotificationRecipientClass(Class), then null is returned.
        Returns:
        Reference to the class that will be open when a notification without a CloudPage or OpenDirect URL is tapped.

      • setNotificationRecipientClass

        public void setNotificationRecipientClass(Class<?> clazz)
        Setter for the Activity that should launch when a notification without a CloudPage or OpenDirect url is tapped.

        If you do not set this class, the SDK will launch the application's Launcher activity.

        To set the Activity that should launch when a notification with a CloudPage or OpenDirect url is tapped, see setCloudPageRecipient(Class) or setOpenDirectRecipient(Class).
        Parameters:
        clazz - Reference to the Activity you wish to launch when a notification without a CloudPage or OpenDirect URL is tapped..

      • getNotificationResourceId

        public static Integer getNotificationResourceId()
        Getter for the notification icon that you set with setNotificationResourceId(Integer).

        If you did not set this class in setNotificationResourceId(Integer), then null is returned.
        Returns:
        Resource id of the icon to use for the notification

      • setNotificationResourceId

        public void setNotificationResourceId(Integer notificationResourceId)
        Setter for the notification icon to be used in the notification.

        Each notification requires an icon to meet the specs provided by Google. Android 5.0 enforces those standards. http://developer.android.com/design/style/iconography.html#notification

        If you do not set this resource, then the SDK will use the default icon for your app which may not meet the standards for Android 5.0.
        Parameters:
        notificationResourceId - Resource id of the icon to use for the notification

      • isPushEnabled

        public boolean isPushEnabled()
        Checks persistent preferences for the state of Push. The SDK ships with Push enabled by default. Best practice is to allow your customers to disable or enable push through a preferences or settings activity. Use enablePush() or disablePush() to respond to your customer preferences.
        Returns:
        boolean The state of push, either enabled (true) or disabled (false)
        See Also:
        enablePush(), disablePush()

      • enablePush

        public void enablePush()
                throws ETException
        Enables push in the SDK.

        This method should be called when explicit permission for Push has been given by your customer.

        Throws:
        ETException
        See Also:
        isPushEnabled(), disablePush()

      • disablePush

        public void disablePush()
                 throws ETException
        Disables push in the SDK.

        This method should be called when explicit permission for Push has been revoked by your customer.

        Throws:
        ETException
        See Also:
        isPushEnabled(), enablePush()

      • addAttribute

        public void addAttribute(String attribute,
                String value)
                  throws ETException
        Adds a value to a defined attribute within the SFMC Contact model for your customer.

        The attribute must be defined within the SFMC Contact model prior to adding a value. If the attribute does not exist within the SFMC Contact model, then this attribute will be ignored within the SFMC.

        If you previously called addAttribute(String, String) for this attribute, then the value will be updated with the new value and sent to the SFMC.

        All attribute values set with this method persist through the installation of the app on your customer device.

        Note that attribute mapping is case sensitive, and spaces should be avoided when setting up new attributes in the SFMC Contact model.
        Parameters:
        attribute - Attribute name as currently defined within the SFMC Contact Model.
        value - Value to assign to that attribute for your customer
        Throws:
        ETException

      • removeAttribute

        public void removeAttribute(String attribute)
                     throws ETException
        Removes an attribute from the list of attributes created with addAttribute(String, String) from being be sent to the SFMC.

        Note: this method removes the attribute from future sends. It does not change the actual value, nor does it remove it from the SFMC Contact model. It simply means that the last value for this attribute will no longer be sent.

        If you want to set the value within the SFMC Contact model for this attribute to blanks, then you should call addAttribute(String, String) with a blank value. Example:

        addAttribute("First_Name", "");

        Note that attribute mapping is case sensitive, and spaces should be avoided when setting up new attributes in the SFMC Contact model.
        Parameters:
        attribute - Attribute name as currently defined within the SFMC Contact Model.
        Throws:
        ETException

      • getAttributes

        public ArrayList<Attribute> getAttributes()
                                   throws ETException
        Getter to return the list of attributes that were previously set with addAttribute(String, String).
        Returns:
        ArrayList
        Throws:
        ETException

      • getSystemToken

        public String getSystemToken()
        Returns the current system token (aka. registration token) for the registered device that Google provided for this customer with your GCM Sender Id. For more information see Registering Client Apps
        Returns:
        the system token (aka registration token) as set by Google

      • getOpenDirectRecipient

        public Class<?> getOpenDirectRecipient()
        Getter for the Activity that will launch when a notification with an OpenDirect url is tapped that you have set in setOpenDirectRecipient(Class).

        If you did not set this class in setOpenDirectRecipient(Class), then null is returned.
        Returns:
        Reference to the class that will be launch when a notification with an OpenDirect URL is tapped.

      • setOpenDirectRecipient

        public void setOpenDirectRecipient(Class<?> openDirectRecipient)
        Setter for the Activity that should launch when a notification with an OpenDirect url is tapped.

        If you do not set this class, the SDK will launch the activity set in ETLandingPagePresenter

        If the url is invalid, the SDK will launch the application's Launcher activity.
        Parameters:
        openDirectRecipient - Reference to the Activity you wish to launch when a notification with an OpenDirect URL is tapped..

      • getCloudPageRecipient

        public Class<?> getCloudPageRecipient()
        Getter for the Activity that will launch when a notification with a CloudPage url is tapped that you have set in setCloudPageRecipient(Class).

        If you did not set this class in setCloudPageRecipient(Class), then null is returned.
        Returns:
        Reference to the class that will be launch when a notification with a CloudPage URL is tapped.

      • setCloudPageRecipient

        public void setCloudPageRecipient(Class<?> cloudPageRecipient)
        Setter for the Activity that should launch when a notification with a CloudPage url is tapped.

        If you do not set this class, the SDK will launch the activity set in ETLandingPagePresenter

        If the url is invalid, the SDK will launch the application's Launcher activity.
        Parameters:
        cloudPageRecipient - Reference to the Activity you wish to launch when a notification with a CloudPage URL is tapped..

      • getNotificationAction

        public String getNotificationAction()
        Get the action parameter of the intent to be fired when a notification is received.
        Returns:
        the intent of the action type to use when launching the notification

      • setNotificationAction

        public void setNotificationAction(String notificationAction)
        There are three ways to override the notifications displayed when an alert is received. See ETNotifications for complete list.

        For this option, you will set the notificationAction and notificationUri to be fired when a notification is received.

        Setter for the action parameter of the intent to be fired when a notification is tapped. Used in conjunction with setNotificationActionUri(Uri).

        For example, you might pass something like Intent.ACTION_VIEW.

        You must also call setNotificationActionUri(Uri) to launch a notification intent using this method and you must include the Activity that will respond to the action specified here.
        Parameters:
        notificationAction - the intent action type to use when launching notification

      • setNotificationActionUri

        public void setNotificationActionUri(android.net.Uri notificationActionUri)
        Setter for the Intent data URI to use when a notification is tapped. Used in conjunction with setNotificationAction(String).

        For example, you might pass something like Intent.ACTION_VIEW.

        You must also call setNotificationAction(String) to launch this notification intent.
        Parameters:
        notificationActionUri - URI to use for notification intent

      • getNotificationActionUri

        public android.net.Uri getNotificationActionUri()
        Getter for the Intent data URI to use when a notification is clicked as set by setNotificationActionUri(Uri).

        If the URI was not set with setNotificationActionUri(Uri), then returns null.
        Returns:
        URI to use for the notification intent
